content.title: Tripura Lynching/Mob Violence Victim Compensation Scheme
content.beneficiary: Victims of lynching/mob violence and their dependents
content.details: The 'Tripura Lynching/Mob Violence Victim Compensation Scheme' was launched on 14th August 2018 to provide financial support to victims or their dependents who have suffered loss or injury due to lynching/mob violence. This scheme was formulated following the Supreme Court's order on 17.07.2018.
benefits: Minimum compensation of ₹4 Lakhs for death
₹2 Lakhs for permanent disability (80% or more)
eligibility: The victim must be a resident of Tripura.
Victims or dependents who have suffered loss or injury due to lynching/mob violence.
Compensation is available if ordered by the Court.
Victims must report the crime to the local Police Station.
Victims must cooperate with the Police and prosecution.
Dependents may claim compensation if the family becomes destitute due to the victim's death.
exclusions: Claims made after six months of the crime.
Cases covered under the Motor Vehicle Act.
Existing schemes/facilities like extremist violence scheme.
content.application_process: Offline. Victims or dependents must contact the District Magistrate & Collector/Sub Divisional Magistrate and submit an application with required documents.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide financial support to victims of lynching/mob violence.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented through the District Magistrate & Collectors of the State.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched on 14th August 2018.

faqs.question: What does 'Dependent' mean?
faqs.answer: 'Dependent' means any spouse, dependent children up to age of 21 years, and dependent parents.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Victims or dependents who have suffered loss or injury due to lynching/mob violence.

faqs.question: What is the quantum of compensation awarded to the victim under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Compensation varies based on loss, medical expenses, and rehabilitation needs, subject to limits specified in the schedule.

faqs.question: What is the limitation of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Claims must be made within six months of the crime.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Submit an application with required documents to the District Magistrate & Collector/Sub Divisional Magistrate.
